Le jeu a un principe qui est vraiment cool, mais la commu est une des pires que j'ai jamais vu. Impossible de faire un match en tueur sans se faire insulter a la fin, les types ont toujours quelques chose a redire, a croire qu'il faudrait les laisser win en fait.

Si vous arrivez a faire avec une commu toxique, foncez, le gameplay est cool, l'atmosph√®re peut √™tre vraiment opressante en survivant et c'est bien sadique de jouer tueur !

This game is great in concept, but horrible in execution. Every single update breaks my game or gives me an EAC client error, and forces me to reinstall. It is incredibly frustrating to have to redownload the game so many times. On top of that, the updates keep making the game worse. Nobody asked for these UI updates, please fix your game before putting make up on stuff. The game is fun, but the game breaking updates/bugs and balancing issues just make it too frustrating to play. Also, good luck ranking up, the matchmaking is ridiculously inconsistent as far as putting you with people of similar rank. Better play with a full squad if you don't want to get god awful teammates.

Very fun game to play with friends!

Enjoy your life and save yourself the frustration by play anything but this game.

At certain point in the game loses it's fun and becomes true nightmare as it pairs casual rank 14 killers with try hard rank 2 survivors. the roles switch as survivors torment their opponent in 4 vs 1 fashion and trapping players in the game or letting the killer leave with a 5 minute no play penalty. 

In the recent update hit boxes have been changed making it more difficult to play as the killer in a match making system that already favors the survivor.

I love this game so much. It is absolutely delightful, and actually very funny when escaping from the killer! Whether you're playing survivor or killer, this game is worth it to buy. You will absolutely never get bored of it, there are a lot of new ranking ways that will keep you addicted! I was recommended this game, and I don't regret going to get it. I 100% recommend it!

This game isn't perfect but I love the shit out of it. Be warned though i've tried my hardest to understand the community and relate with them but it appears that most of them are out to just have the worst time possible. no matter what this game is doing the players are constantly shitting on Behaviour and this game. maybe there is some crazy controversy or something i dont know about. in game its about 50/50 when it comes to peoples attitudes. they are either incredibly nice and having a good time or they are gonna accuse you of breaking unwritten rules and bitch and moan as long as you engage with them.  I like this game and the state it is in or has been in and i look forward to the next state and many more after that.

EDIT: Updating my review since I forgot to include one of my least favorite aspects of the game; the immense fucking grindiness. You wouldn't think that a game like this would have a grind, right? It's not an MMO or anything. But it does, in fact, have one, and it's an excruciatingly long one (and this is coming from someone who plays Old School Runescape for fun.) Every perk in the game has three tiers, which you earn from bloodwebs (which randomly select perks for you to get per character.) Back upon the game's release this was actually a great system for keeping players playing the game, since there weren't very many perks in the game at the time. The issue is that after five years of this game being out, with hundreds of additional perks being added, this system has never been removed, even after much complaining. So on top of having to grind out the characters whose teachable perks you want (takes about ten good matches with bloodpoint offerings to get to that point, but only if you're playing killer, if you're playing survivor it's more,) you also have to go through numerous additional bloodwebs on the character you actually want to play just to get one perk up to its maximum potential. It's absurd that this is still in the game. I have 1.1k hours and I still don't have every perk on every character that I regularly play, and that was with buying all the DLC very early on into me playing. This, in my opinion, is one of the worst parts of the game, and a very large reason I can't recommend it to friends or new players.

Yes, I have over 1k hours in this game. Yeah, I've met a lot of cool people and had some fun with this game. But I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this game anymore until a lot of things change.

1. The game is constantly littered with MASSIVE bugs. Getting stuck in stairs or trapped in the floor for an entire match, sound being completely broken or inconsistent, some perks straight-up not functioning at all, and killer powers being unusable, etc. The development cycle of releasing new content every 3 months instead of focusing on polishing what is already there is incredibly toxic to the game's well-being. You could say that DBD thrives off of new players getting hyped that their favorite film slasher is in the game (I literally bought the game because I heard Michael Myers and other horror slashers were in it,) but the constant, massive, often game-breaking bugs that arise from every update that sometimes persist for *months* afterwards only makes it harder to want to come back to the game.

2. The gameplay loop gets very repetitive and stressful. I hardly play this game anymore outside of streaming it because it's stressful playing high rank solo queue survivor and killer. No game has made me feel less satisfaction from winning a game, and more frustration from losing than Dead by Daylight has. Getting stomped as a killer feels demoralizing, especially when you know that the survivors aren't even playing that well, you're just doing poorly, or sometimes even getting fucked over by bugs and invisible collision hulls on rocks and debris. On the other side, being chased for two minutes and getting downed, then seeing that your teammates have been sneaking around the map looking for totems, or self caring in a corner of the map instead of doing generators, or just doing god damn nothing, is incredibly frustrating. Survive with Friends can be fun, until you run into massive desync issues that the last update introduced that end up cutting your fun short.

3. The developers very often don't take feedback from the players, and when they do, they may take literal years to implement basic changes. The game *still* lacks colorblind options after almost five years, and only a month or two ago was it revealed that they were even working on them, after people were constantly badgering the lead developer about it. It took them four years to nerf Memento Moris, one of the most complained-about killer items for that time. When they finally did it, they announced they would be nerfing keys, an equally loathed survivor item, in a future update. When people asked why they didn't nerf keys in the same update, they said that "The Mori nerf was a simple number change, whereas Keys will require an entire rework of their own." If it was as simple as changing a number from 1 to 2, why hadn't they been changed years ago? Who fuckin' knows? Many perks remain completely useless outside of incredibly niche scenarios, whereas others have remained meta for years. Problematic perks also take years for the developers to nerf. Object of Obsession, a perk that can enable organized groups of survivors to absolutely dominate less experienced killers with little counter, has only just now been announced to *maybe* be getting a nerf after being completely unchanged and unfair for years despite being in the game's first ever licensed DLC, and this was AFTER the backlash they faced from saying "We won't be changing it because the statistics say the Obsession usually dies, so it's fine!"

There's more to complain about like the community which can be irrationally toxic over nothing, but that's unfortunately pretty bog standard for online multiplayer games at this point . I firmly believe that until the team drops the three-month development cycle of new content and instead focuses on improving the game's quality and stability, I'm not likely to play it much more.

If none of our hopes and dreams pan out (I'm sure at least some of them will considering the game's early success), Fall Guys is still one of the feel-good excursions of 2020. How much longevity players can get out of it will vary from person to person, but as someone who had essentially called it quits on the all-too-samey battle royale genre, I'm having a ridiculously fun time right here and now.

They recently did an update that nobody really asked for. However...they started fixing it very quickly. The players can be toxic, but you meet a lot of really nice people through the game as well. <3

I really love this game! It's affordable, easy to learn, and a ton of fun to play! My one issue is that you only have a limited variety of killers and survivors to start out with, and unlocking the unlicensed characters without spending money is a very tedious process that requires a ton of hours of gameplay to accomplish. Still, this is newly one of my favorite games I've discovered recently and I would highly recommend giving it a try!

This game may have many flaws and the dev team may not care about the community, but this game is absolutely perfect for just having a great, fun time with some friends whether it's a 4 man survival or a 5 man kill your friends group. They just need to fix the ranked system because like yikes.

Never have I seen a game punish it's new players so harshly. imagine buying a call of duty game where the only gun you are allowed to use is a pistol but everyone else has assault rifle's already. You wouldn't play for long. So they have to give steep return bonuses. But that will get you to play 2 rounds tops. that is of course if you don't mind the 20 minute wait to find a lobby.
